@graph.caption: These spicy zucchini and black bean tacos are delicious, protein packed, and very easy to make.

@graph.name: Spicy Zucchini and Black Bean Tacos « Dora's Table
@graph.description: Spicy Zucchini and Black Bean Tacos, delicious, protein packed, and very easy to make.  They are topped with a Chile de Arbol Almond Sauce.

itemListElement.name: Spicy Zucchini and Black Bean Tacos

@graph.headline: Spicy Zucchini and Black Bean Tacos

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Spicy Zucchini and Black Bean Tacos
@graph.description: These spicy zucchini and black bean tacos are delicious, protein packed, and very easy to make.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat vegetable oil to medium heat in a large sauté pan. Add onion and sweat for 2-3 minutes or until the onion is tender and translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat vegetable oil to medium heat in a large sauté pan. Add onion and sweat for 2-3 minutes or until the onion is tender and translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the zucchini and cook until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Add the black beans and mix well. Let cook for 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the zucchini and cook until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Add the black beans and mix well. Let cook for 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the sauce: heat a griddle, comal, or cast iron pan to medium-high heat. Toast chiles on each side until lightly toasted, about 30 seconds on each side. Remove from pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the sauce: heat a griddle, comal, or cast iron pan to medium-high heat. Toast chiles on each side until lightly toasted, about 30 seconds on each side. Remove from pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the almonds to the pan and toast until golden, about 2 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the almonds to the pan and toast until golden, about 2 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Toast the onion, and the garlic until slightly charred, about 4 minutes on each side.
recipeInstructions.name: Toast the onion, and the garlic until slightly charred, about 4 minutes on each side.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the almonds, onion, garlic, and chiles in the blender. Add the warm vegetable stock and 2 tsp. of vinegar. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Sauce should be thick and creamy.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the almonds, onion, garlic, and chiles in the blender. Add the warm vegetable stock and 2 tsp. of vinegar. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Sauce should be thick and creamy.

@graph.keywords: black bean tacos, spicy black bean tacos, vegan tacos, vegetarian tacos
